title: Westwood moves into lead at Players as McIlroy misses cut
description: England's Lee Westwood hits a sensational bogey-free six-under 66 to move into the halfway lead at the Players Championship at TPC Sawgrass.

title: Would you scrap your car for public transport credits?
description: A scheme in the Midlands is encouraging people to scrap their cars to get public transport credits.

title: Roblox: 'We paid off our parents' mortgage making video games'
description: The popularity of online gaming platform Roblox has allowed some developers to make serious money.

title: A new rival, history repeating itself & cakes in 'Covid Cafe' - Wales' Biggar eyes Grand Slam
description: As Wales's Grand Slam bid continues in Italy, fly-half Dan Biggar looks to their 2019 campaign - and cakes - as inspiration.

title: Archer will 'do everything in my power' to play in T20 World Cup & Ashes
description: England bowler Jofra Archer says he must "take care" of his elbow injury if he wants to play a full part in the Twenty20 World Cup and the Ashes this year.

title: Scientists unlock mysteries of world's oldest 'computer'
description: The 2,000-year-old mechanism has baffled experts since it was discovered on a shipwreck in 1901.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'I made this'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

title: UK economy shrank 2.9% in January amid lockdown
description: Official figures show the UK's gross domestic product is 9% smaller than before the Covid pandemic.

title: Lockdown in Wales: Hairdressers to reopen but retail remains closed
description: People will soon be able meet friends in their garden, visit care homes inside and play golf.

title: The Scottish mercenary hired to kill Pablo Escobar
description: How a team of British combatants travelled to Colombia to assassinate the world's most dangerous man.

title: Etna: Life beneath the volcanic dust of repeated eruptions
description: Three weeks of spectacular blasts have amazed onlookers - but caused untold damage for Sicilians.

title: Relaxation of rules on outdoor meeting in Scotland
description: Up to four adults from two different households are now able to meet up outside, including in gardens.

title: The papers: Met faces Sarah case inquiry and William hits back
description: The Sarah Everard case and Prince William's response to the Sussexes' interview dominate the papers.

title: Sarah Everard case: Met police faces watchdog investigation
description: The police watchdog will examine the force's handling of an earlier indecent exposure allegation against the officer suspected of murdering her.

title: Top Gear trio on James Bond, mid-life crises and UK-only trips
description: The BBC One series is returning with James Bond cars, mid-life crises and all-British locations.

title: Catcalling: The sisters who are making a noise to stop street harassment of women
description: Campaigners tell the BBC how they are working to address the root causes of violence against women.

title: Musicians in lockdown: 'My piano kept me going'
description: A series of portraits aims to show the impact of the pandemic on musicians' livelihoods.

title: Covid: Does Tanzania have a hidden epidemic?
description: The Tanzanian authorities have not published data on coronavirus infections or deaths for many months.

title: Turing Scheme: What is the Erasmus replacement?
description: What will Brexit mean for students in the UK wanting to work or study abroad?

title: Meghan Markle interview: African-American women react
description: Many African-American women were delighted when one of their own married a real prince - but times have changed.

title: What happens if I don't get the Covid vaccine?
description: There are multiple coronavirus vaccines being rolled out in countries across the UK and around the world. What happens if you don't want it?

title: Running from terror in north-east Mozambique
description: A militant Islamist insurgency in north-east Mozambique has forced half a million people to flee for fear of beheadings and abductions.

title: A yak herder in the Himalayas: ‘I am the last shepherd in my family’
description: Phuntsog Tsering lives a tough life, herding yaks at 5,000m in the Himalayas and is one of the last shepherds left in his village.

title: Twins peak with more born than ever before
description: One in every 42 children is born a twin and much has changed over the past 30 years, a report finds.

title: Brown stink bug among 'future threats' to gardens
description: Gardeners are being urged to be on alert for the stink bug and other pests predicted to arrive in the UK.

title: BBC announces new Bitesize learning plans
description: The new programmes will help support both pupils and teachers across the UK.

title: Royal Mail to pilot Sunday parcel delivery
description: The postal service will make deliveries for major retailers as online shopping continues to grow.

title: 'I play digital music through my 1949 radio'
description: People share some of their collections of vintage technology and explain why it is still useful.
